questions.question: The _____ is too high for it to be considered _____.
Which one of the following is the area under the given curve for the interval [0,1]?
questions.explanation: Computed by integrating the piecewise function over [0,1].

questions.question: Which one of the following logical inferences is correct based on the passage about metrics and work culture?
options: Metrics are useful in organizations with poor work culture
Metrics are useful in organizations with good work culture
Metrics are always counterproductive in good work culture
Metrics are never useful in good work culture
correct: Metrics are useful in organizations with good work culture
questions.explanation: Passage states metrics improve outcomes only in good work culture.

questions.question: What is the probability of getting an orange ball in the next draw?
questions.explanation: Based on conditional probability after replacement rules.

questions.question: Which one of the following statements is correct based on the triangle placement conditions?
options: P cannot be placed at a corner
S cannot be placed at a corner
U cannot be placed at a mid-point
R cannot be placed at a corner
correct: S cannot be placed at a corner
questions.explanation: Derived from parallel and placement constraints.

questions.question: What is the least number of additional straight ropes needed to divide the land into four similar plots?
Which one of the following statements is TRUE for all positive functions f(n)?
options: f(n²) = Θ(f(n)²), when f(n) is polynomial
f(n²) = O(f(n)²), when f(n) is exponential
